Configure Project/Archive Creation Options

Use the Configure Project dialog box (Admin | Configure Project | Archives | Creation Attributes) to set the following options on newly created archives:

  • Whether or not multiple locks are allowed on an archive
  • The owner of archives
  • An access list for archives
  • Write protection for archives
  • Whether or not an archive is created when you check in a workfile if Version Manager cannot find one for the file
  • Whether or not a newly created archive is split for use with the Revision Library feature of the Version Manager File Server

Field Descriptions

Archives | Creation Attributes
Locks Allowed on Each Archive Do one of the following:
Select One to allow only one lock per archive.
Select More Than One to allow multiple locks per archive.
Owner Specify the user ID of the owner of new archives. The value <Current User> is the User who is running Version Manager.
Access List Enter the groups and individual Users (user IDs) who can access newly created archives. The groups and user IDs that you specify must be defined in the access control database. The values must be separated by commas. The combined value of the field cannot exceed 254 characters in length.
Write protect archive Select this check box to write-protect archives. Setting this option protects archives from inadvertent deletion or modification.
OK to create new archives on check in Select this check box to automatically create an archive when you check in a workfile if Version Manager cannot find one for the file. Otherwise, an error message is issued and no archive is created. This option applies only to the command-line interface.
Split On Create Select this check box to automatically split new archives into separate metadata and revision components if they are mapped to a revision path by the Version Manager File Server. This directive is for use with the Revision Library feature of the Version Manager File Server.

See Also
